title: Poson Poya reminds us that ‘Ahimsa’ is a timeless value - President
byline: In a world where violence continues to afflict humanity on many fronts, Poson Poya Day reminds us that ‘Ahimsa’ is a timeless value that safeguards both one’s own and others’ right to life and freedom, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said in his Poson message.

title: Poson Full Moon Poya Day, today
byline: Today is the Poson full moon Poya day.

title: “Let us reflect on noble path taken by Arahant Mahinda Thero on this Poson Poya”
byline: It is important that we repeatedly reflect upon the noble path taken by Arahant Mahinda Thero to bring the light of the supreme teachings of Dhamma into our lives, and strive to attain that light and inner peace through both Amisa Pooja and Pratipatti Pooja of Dhamma, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has said.

title: Showers to increase from today
byline: Due to the effect of the active southwest monsoon condition, showery condition is expected to enhance in the southwestern part of the island from today (10), with strong wind gusts over the island and in the sea areas, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Three police officers injured after being assaulted by a group in Beruwala
byline: Three police personnel, including the Beruwala Police Crimes OIC have sustained injuries following an assault by a group of individuals, Police said.

title: 10-hour water cut in several areas tomorrow
byline: A 10-hour water cut will be imposed in several areas in the Gampaha District tomorrow (June 11), the National Water Supply & Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced.

title: ‘Deranabhiwandana 2025’ at Ruwanweli Maha Seya today
byline: The ‘Deranabhiwandana 2025’ programme will take place at the Ruwanweli Maha Seya in Anuradhapura throughout the day today (June 10).

title: Let’s follow the path of Buddhism and build a self-sufficient country - Opposition Leader
byline: We should follow the path of Buddhism and build a self-sufficient country, Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa has said.

title: Trump sends another 2,000 National Guards and 700 Marines to LA on fourth day of unrest
byline: US President Donald Trump has ordered the temporary deployment of about 700 Marines to Los Angeles, as he pledged those protesting his aggressive immigration policies would be “hit harder” than ever.

title: US State Dept resumes processing Harvard student visas after judge’s ruling
byline: The United States State Department directed all US missions abroad and consular sections to resume processing Harvard University student and exchange visitor visas after a federal judge in Boston last week temporarily blocked President Donald Trump’s latest ban on foreign students at the Ivy League institution.

title: Shocking accident captured on CCTV in Horana
byline: A shocking accident involving a motorcycle and a three-wheeler colliding with a car heading from the opposite direction has been captured on CCTV in Wagawatta, Horana.

title: First Deputy Managing Director of IMF to visit Sri Lanka
byline: Dr. Gita Gopinath, the First Deputy Managing Director (FDMD) of the International Monetary Fund (IMF), is scheduled to visit Sri Lanka from 15-16 June 2025, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) said.

title: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya brought to court
byline: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) yesterday (10) has been brought to court.

title: Frederick Forsyth, former spy and Day of the Jackal author, dies aged 86
byline: Best-selling British novelist Frederick Forsyth, author of about 20 spy thrillers, has died at the age of 86.

title: Russia halts flights at Moscow airport after wave of Ukrainian drone attacks
byline: Russia’s civil aviation authority, Rosaviatsia, has announced that it temporarily suspended flights at all four major airports serving Moscow to ensure safety, after the defence ministry said Ukraine was carrying out a drone attack on Russia.

title: Five Sri Lankans arrested while attempting to illegally enter India
byline: Five Sri Lankans who attempted to enter India illegally have been taken into custody by Indian authorities.

title: Austria school shooting: Nine people dead, several injured
byline: At least nine people have been killed in a shooting incident at a school in the Austrian city of Graz and several others have been injured, Austrian media including Kronen Zeitung reported.

title: 400 tons of substandard steel worth over Rs. 100 mn seized
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority has taken steps to raid a factory producing substandard steel.

title: Five arrested for assaulting Police officers in Beruwala remanded
byline: Five individuals, who were arrested for allegedly assaulting three Police officers in Beruwala have been remanded.

title: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya remanded
byline: Suspended Commissioner General of Prisons Thushara Upuldeniya, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) yesterday (09) has been remanded until tomorrow (11), Ada Derana reporter said.

title: ‘Red’ warning issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued a ‘Red’ warning for strong winds and rough seas.

title: Let’s unite in advancing positive social transformation -President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasized that the transformation which took place in the Sri Lankan society with the introduction of Buddhism laid the foundation for a disciplined and culturally sophisticated nation.

title: Revised electricity tariffs to be announced before end of this week: PUCSL
byline: The revised electricity tariffs for the second half of 2025 will be announced before the end of this week, the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced.

title: Greta Thunberg deported, Israel says, after Gaza aid boat intercepted
byline: Israel says it has begun to deport 12 pro-Palestinian activists, including Swedish campaigner Greta Thunberg, whose Gaza-bound aid boat was seized by Israeli forces in the Mediterranean on Monday.

title: 10 dead in Austria school shooting: mayor
byline: Ten people died on Tuesday after a suspected shooter opened fire in a school in the southeastern Austrian city of Graz, the local mayor was quoted as saying.

title: Four crew members missing as Singapore-flagged cargo ship burns off India coast
byline: India’s Coast Guard is continuing efforts to douse a fire on a Singapore-flagged cargo ship in the Arabian Sea near the coast of the southern state of Kerala.

title: China calls for strengthening global civilizational dialogue on UN’s New International Day
byline: On the first-ever International Day of Dialogue Among Civilizations, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi delivered a video message emphasizing the need for mutual respect, cultural exchange, and peaceful coexistence in an increasingly interconnected world, News.Az reports.

title: Four Acting Ministers appointed during President’s Germany visit
byline: Acting Ministers have been appointed for four key ministries in light of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s official visit to the Federal Republic of Germany, undertaken at the invitation of German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier.

title: President Anura Kumara departs for official visit to Germany
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has left the island short while ago, to embark on a three-day official visit to Germany from June 11 to 13, 2025.

title: Sri Lanka’s Piyumal Sithum named first runner-up at Manhunt International 2025
byline: Piyumal Sithum Pattuwearachchi of Sri Lanka was named First Runner-Up at the 23rd edition of Manhunt International, held today (10) in Bangkok, Thailand.

title: Sri Lanka shock Chinese Taipei 3-1 in AFC qualifier
byline: Sri Lanka beat Chinese Taipei 3-1 in Matchday 2 of the AFC Asian Cup 2027 Qualifying Round 3, Group D, on Tuesday (June 10) at the Colombo Racecourse.
